description:
Equipment:

Astrofaktoria Newton 350/14000 on NEQ-6
T7 camera (ASI120MM) + filters 950nm & 1000nm (stacked)

Exposition:
600 x 4 seconds (gain 20/100, gamma 95)

Here you can find all of the layers which I used to create this smooth photo (just to confirm that it's not a fake like some people said ;) ):

https://www.astrobin.com/suxe7f/?nc=user

Main picture is composition of 4 different pictures which different level of "unsharp masing". I put it together and removed sharpening artifacts by using masks and moving detail of surface for main layer with minimal processing. That's why picture is smooth :)

Seeing was extremely good taht day and also there was no wind - that's why I was succesfull with register a lot of detail - especially "horseshoe" shape of Phoebe Regio :)
title: Surface of Venus - thermal emission map (vs sim) - 8th of May 2020
